title: The difference between the selling prices of an article sold at 4% and 3% profit is 3. Then what is the cost price of the article? - Play with maths - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price of the article = ₹ x. , accordingly :- x.(1+4/100) - x .(1+3/100) = 3. or, x.{ 1+ 4/100 - 1 - 3/100} = 3. or, x.(1/100) = 3. or, x = ₹ 300. Answer.
Selling price difference is given sold when the article is sold at 4% & 3% profit C * (104/100) - C * (103/100) = 3 C = 300
